intro: Eupatorium kleinii, commonly known as the slender false dragonhead, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, producing clusters of small, pale blue to purple flowers. Eupatorium kleinii is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
